intro: Castilleja luteovirens, commonly known as the yellow-green Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow-orange flowers that resemble a paintbrush. The plant has specialized roots that attach to the roots of other plants, allowing it to absorb nutrients from its host. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Castilleja luteovirens plays a role in supporting pollinators and is often found in association with various grasses and shrubs.
